EXT. POLICE TRAINING FACILITY- BRONX, NY- DAY

dialogues.speaker: MAIN CREDITS ROLL..
dialogues.text: MUSIC: Steely Dan's blues\funk classic "Daddy Don't Live That New York City No More".. We're in midtown. The 15TH PRECINCT BUILDING. DETECTIVE TONY CARUSO, JR. pulls up out front. He gets ou and starts up the steps. Then he pauses. He's noticed some LITTER on the sidewalk. A plastic cup o fast-food wrapper. Tony picks it up, and dutifully drops into a TRASH CAN. Then he continues up the steps. Through the doors. To sta work. NOTE: This credit sequence will ALTER SLIGHTLY each episo As Tony arrives for work, he'll stop and perform a DIFFER SMALL ACT OF KINDNESS. One time he'll hold somebody's umbrella, one time he'll help carry a baby stroller, etc. He's a good cop.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM BLAM BLAM BLAM BLAM
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: a PAPER TARGET, a SILHOUETTE OF AN ARMED THUG. shooter's aim is PERFECT. A tight cluster, around the hea We're at Rodman's Neck, a huge training facility in the Bronx. It's like a Hollywood backlot. Fake buildings. Moc bad guys. Another TARGET swings into view. The shooter spins! BLAM BLAM! The shooter is LT. TONY CARUSO JR, lead detective on New York's elite All-City Homicide Squad. A man of quiet authority. Clean cut. Deliberate. Focused. Tony continues to shoot. BLAM BLAM BLAM BLAM!

dialogues.speaker: INT. TRAINING FACILITY- MAIN OFFICE- LATER
dialogues.text: Tony is at the counter. The range supervisor, SGT. CHET FINCH, a weathered, veteran cop, tallies up his score.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 982. That's a range record. The highest your old man ever got was 800.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: He probably cheated.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FINCH
dialogues.text: I know he cheated.

dialogues.speaker: EXT./INT. TONY'S CAR- INTERSECTION- BROOKLYN- NIGHT
dialogues.text: It's late. Tony and his father are driving home. BIG TONY is a natural-born hustler. Irreverent. Shameless We don't want to love him, but we love him. They're stopped at a RED LIGHT. The streets are empty. Brooklyn is dead. You would run this light. So would I. Anybody would. But Tony is a boy scout. Obsessively hones

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: You can go. (beat) The light's busted. You can go. Tony doesn't move. BIG TONY (CONT’D) It's been busted all week.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I'm gonna give it a minute.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: You don't believe me?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: If you told me you were lying, I wouldn't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: That's very funny. That's a nice way to talk to your father. (then) I talked to Chet Finch. He said you crushed it at the range on Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talked to Chet Finch?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: It didn't surprise me. You could always shoot. Remember Boy Scout camp? You won all those medals-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Badges.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Badges. Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: If you were there, you would know.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: I wasn't there. I was a shitty dad. But it doesn't matter now because we're both gonna die tonight in this car. They're gonna find us tomorrow, staring at that facacta light, dead of starvation.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You're not supposed to have contact with anyone in the department.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: It wasn't contact.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That's a condition of your parole-

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: It wasn't contact. We weren't exchanging bodily fluids. We talked for ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That's contact! Conversation is contact! Especially with Chet Finch. He was on your crew, for God's sake.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Someone buys me a Heineken, I'm gonna sit down. That's how God made me. Especially if they're bragging on my boy.  4. A CAR behind them HONKS impatiently. BIG TONY (CONT’D) Now they're honking. (Tony doesn't move) You can go. You're a cop.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Exactly. I'm a cop.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: You think running a red light is gonna turn you into me? Tony doesn't respond. Or move. HONK HONK. HONK. HONK.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. AMBROSE PARK- QUEENS- DAWN
dialogues.text: Early morning. TWO TEENAGERS on DIRT BIKES roar through t park. CYCLISTS and JOGGERS scramble out of their way. There's something up ahead, lying across the trail. Holy shit! It's a BODY! The FIRST BIKER swerves! He wipes out! The Biker recovers, and takes a closer look. The Dead Man has been shot in the chest. Multiple times. And there's a BLACK PLASTIC BAG over his head.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CARUSO HOUSE- BROOKLYN- SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Tony and his dad share this modest row house in Bay Ridge They're a crime-fighting, multi-generational Odd Couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony's bedroom. As meticulous and orderly as he is. We PAN THE WALLS. PHOTOS of EVAN, his 8 year old son.. bo on Forensics, Abnormal Psychology.. medals and citations. And a makeshift case board, dedicated to his mother. Ther are old newspaper articles: HIT AND RUN KILLS MOTHER OF T And DIAGRAMS and PHOTOS of the corner in Queens where she killed. The ALARM CLICKS ON. It plays his favorite music, BOSSA NOVA.  5. Tony stirs. He opens a drawer in his nightstand, and remo his SERVICE REVOLVER, a Glock 19.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KITCHEN- MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Downstairs. Big Tony is a foodie. He's preparing a multi- course gourmet Italian breakfast, while talking on the phone. .

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: (into phone) Diagonally? What does that mean? So diagonally is bigger? So the next time I measure my pecker I'm gonna measure it diagonally. Tony enters. BIG TONY (CONT’D) I'll catch you later. The girl from Ipanema just woke up. (hangs up) That was Wendell Kirk. He just found us a new TV. A 62 inch Vimeo.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: We don't need a new TV.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: It's a gift. What was I supposed to say? Sit down. Tony, sit. The first thing every cop learns: never pass up a real breakfast. You catch a case, who knows when you'll eat again. Big Tony lovingly serves his son breakfast. They're basically an old married couple. Tony eats a muffin. BIG TONY (CONT’D) You can't eat that dry. Put some butter on that.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: When's your interview?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: About ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not "about ten". Ten. It's ten. It's a job interview. You should get there early.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Will you relax. You're making the coffee nervous.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I'm just saying. Gabby went to a lot of trouble-

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: She's Gabby now?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Gabriel. Inspector Vasquez.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: How cozy is that? My son and the bitch who can't wait to throw me back in jail.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I'm not involved with your P.O.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: I'm not blind. I was at the release hearing. I had to step over your tongue to get out the door.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Do you have a shirt?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Yes I have a shirt.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: With a collar? A real shirt?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Yes. With a collar. Who's the parent here?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Exactly. During this, Tony fiddles with a handheld BALL AND STRIKE COUNTER. CLICK CLICK CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Evan's little league game. They asked me to umpire. Four o'clock. And you're coming. (Big Tony winces) Dad. You're coming. You haven't been to a game all year.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: What would I do, sit in the bleachers with your ex and her lesbian wife?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You don't have to say "lesbian wife". You can just say wife. During this, Tony starts to use a NAPKIN. Then he puts it back, and tears off a PAPER TOWEL instead.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: (indicates the NAPKINS) Why? Because they say "Wendys"? You are pathological, you know that? They're just napkins! Everybody takes them!

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That doesn't make it right. If you break one rule, they all break.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Hey. Don't have to quote your mother to me. I was married to the woman for 17 years.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You were married to her. But I listened to her. Big Tony collects the "stolen" napkins.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: You know what, Saint Francis? This time I'm calling your bluff. You want me to return the napkins? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You come with me. We'll go back to Wendys. We'll find the Manager. "Here are the ten napkins you've been looking for. I confess! It was me!" (waving a PACKET) Oh wait. Here's a Splenda from the I-Hop in Fairfield. I'11 mail it to them. During this, Tony's CELL PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (answering PHONE) Caruso. Yeah I'm catching. (listens) I'm leaving now.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. AMBROSE PARK- STAGING AREA- MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: The park is now a FULL-ON CRIME SCENE. YELLOW TAPE. SQUAD CARS. A FORENSIC TEAM. AN AMBULANCE. Tony approaches the perimeter. TWO ROOKIE UNIFORMS are on duty. The First Rookie is unshaven.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Sgt. Loomis?

dialogues.speaker: FIRST ROOKIE
dialogues.text: He's in the Camry.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Did you lose your razor, Officer?

dialogues.speaker: FIRST ROOKIE
dialogues.text: No sir.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That's an infraction.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST ROOKIE
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it. Thank you, sir. Tony walks away. After he's gone.. FIRST ROOKIE (CONT’D) (rolling his eyes) It's like having a den mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: FIRST ROOKIE
dialogues.text: You heard of Tony Caruso? Diamond Tony? That's his son.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND ROOKIE
dialogues.text: He's on the job?

dialogues.speaker: FIRST ROOKIE
dialogues.text: Top of the food chain. All City Homicide.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND ROOKIE
dialogues.text: He's a cop? (beat) And he didn't change his name?

dialogues.speaker: INT./EXT. LOOMIS'S SEDAN- STAGING AREA- SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Tony approaches a PARKED SEDAN. His partner, DETECTIVE SG BURL LOOMIS, is behind the wheel. 50's. Rumpled. Cynical. Burnt out. He's fast asleep.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Hey Cowboy. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: (groggy) Hhhmm. Waiting for you. Tony shakes Loomis. Offers him some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What if somebody saw you? They'd pull your badge.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Yeah. That would be terrible. I'd have to retire early.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Here's a question. When you do finally retire, how will anyone know?  10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony & Loomis walk up a hill, toward the body. Loomis is of shape. He falls behind.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Don't wait for me. I promised your old man I'd watch your back, so that's what I'm doing. They reach the dump site. A uniform officer, SGT. CHEADLE greets them.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. CHEADLE
dialogues.text: Lieutenant. Glad you're here. This one's a real freak show. Loomis joins them, wheezing from the climb.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (indicates Loomis) Well, we know HE didn't do it. (resuming, to Cheadle) Any I.D.?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. CHEADLE
dialogues.text: Not yet. Nobody's touched him. It looks like a taxpayer. Tony examines the BODY. He's a world-class investigator. Out of respect, the other cops step away and give him spa SGT. CHEADLE (CONT’D) What the hell is wrong with this town?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Nothing a well-placed hydrogen bomb couldn't cure. The victim has been shot in the chest, multiple times. Pl there's a BLACK PLASTIC TRASHBAG over his head.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. CHEADLE
dialogues.text: Should we cut the bag?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No. Let's wait for the good doctor.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Time of death?  11.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I'm guessing. Two days.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: So Saturday night?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Maybe. This isn't the primary. He was killed somewhere else. (examines the shoes) No scuff marks. He wasn't dragged, he was carried. Who found him? Nearby: the DIRT BIKERS are being questioned.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. CHEADLE
dialogues.text: A couple of dirt bikers. It's illegal in the park, so they ride at dawn.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Get a statement. Separately. Separate cars. And stay away from that bush.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. CHEADLE
dialogues.text: Did you see something?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Poison sumac.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: (chuckles ) One of the perks of having a boy scout for a partner. Tony looks around. He misses nothing.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: They parked down the hill. They carried him 35, maybe 40 yards. Why'd they leave him here, out in the open? Another ten feet they're in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Maybe they were interrupted.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Maybe. (beat) Maybe they wanted him found.  12.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CARUSO HOUSE- STREET- SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Back at the house. An young woman ROARS up on a vintage Sportster Harley Davidson. Meet GABRIEL VASQUEZ, Big Tony probation officer. Street smart, with a mischievous sense humor. Gabby on her chopper: the sexiest thing on the internet. She's parked in front of a FIRE HYDRANT. Gabby picks up a EMPTY TRASH CAN, flips it over, and drops it over the hydrant. Problem solved. An ELDERLY NEIGHBOR, sitting on a stoop, watches her. Gab smiles and winks.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CARUSO HOUSE- LIVING ROOM- SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Inside. Big Tony is installing a NEW TV MONITOR with WENDELL, an old slacker friend.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Where's the other input? This wire's too big.. etc. Gabby enters. The guys are distracted and don't notice he She picks up the REMOTE and CLICKS THE TV OFF. For a beat, the guys are confused. They think the monitor broken. They finally notice Gabby.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: I left you two messages.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: I know. My phone died. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL
dialogues.text: (dimly ) Who is this? Gabby flashes her P.O. SHIELD.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: "This" is Gabriel Vasquez. I'm his probation officer. Gabby picks up a TOWEL- twirls it, rolls it up- then SNAP LIKE A WHIP at Big Tony It nicks his ear. It bleeds a little.  13.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: YOW! Are you allowed to do that?!

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: I doubt it. (to Wendell) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: (gulp) Wendell Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Wendell Kirk. Do you have a receipt for this TV?

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL
dialogues.text: It was a floor model. They don't give receipts-

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Bullshit. You always get a receipt.

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL
dialogues.text: Not at Target.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: You want a receipt? Give me twelve hours. I can get you a receipt.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Pack it up, Wendell. Wendell anxiously carries some boxes out the door.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I called the lumber yard. They said you showed up but then left before the interview.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Okay. Here's the thing. I got there. The supervisor was a guy named Randy Buttons. I don't know Randy too well, but I know his wife, Mrs. Buttons, very well. So I bailed. Believe me, I saved everyone a world of trouble.  14.

dialogues.speaker: WHAPPP
dialogues.text: There's a

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: So we have to find an employer whose wife you never tapped?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: It's a big city. There has to be someone. Gabby SNAPS THE TOWEL at him again. BIG TONY (CONT’D) YOW! Gabby, Inspector, give me some credit. I'm walking the line here. You asked me to sell my liquor license, I sold it, no problem. You asked me to move in with my kid, here I am. I'm walking the line. You gave me 90 days to find a job. I'll do it. I have three weeks left.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Three weeks, Tony. (sigh) Why do I let you slide like this?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Because you get me. Because we're kindred spirits. COLLECTION OF FAMILY PHOTOS on a wall. Gabby admires a photo of Tony, shirtless, at the beach. Any wom would. Gabby not

dialogues.speaker: JACK LIVI
dialogues.text: BIG TONY (CONT’D) (teasing her) You want a copy of that one?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Shut up. ices ANOTHER PHOTO: Big Tony and his ex-partner, NGSTON.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that Jack Livingston? Your ex- partner? I thought you hated him.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Hatred is too weak a word.  15.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Then why- ?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: I keep that picture there to remind me what's really important in life.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Outliving that prick. We ZOOM IN to the PHOTO OF JACK LIVINGSTON...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. AMBROSE PARK- CRIME SCENE- SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Back at the crime scene. DR. ZEE, the Medical Examiner, i carefully cutting the BLACK BAG off the victim.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: All right. Let's meet our mystery guest. The bag is cut away, revealing a familiar face. It's Jack Livingston! The ex cop. Big Tony's nemesis. Everyone recognizes him. A stunned beat.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Holy crispy crap.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MEDICAL EXAMINER'S OFFICE- LATER
dialogues.text: Livingston's widow, DONNA, is identifying the body. Early 40's. Attractive to men, and she knows it. Tony and Loomis are there. So is their boss, CAPT. R.H. DELGETTY, DEPUTY CHIEF OF DETECTIVES. Ambitious. Marine- tough. Delgetty is restrained, soft-spoken.. which someho makes her more intimidating.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: I don't know what I'm doing here. You knew him longer than I did.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: The law says a family member, if possible. Whenever you're ready.  16. These days, victim IDs are done by close circuit. Delgett clicks on a MONITOR. Livingston's lifeless face appears. CAPT. DELGETTY (CONT’D) Is that your husband? Donna? I need you to indicate yes. Donna nods. She lovingly touches the monitor screen. CAPT. DELGETTY (CONT’D) Donna, I'm so sorry. I'm speaking for the whole department-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Save your tears, Captain. Jack was dead to you, to all of you, the minute he agreed to testify.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: Nobody in this room thinks that. You know Tony Caruso and Burl Loomis. (Donna nods) They're on the All-City Homicide Squad. They're the best of the best. That's an indication of how seriously we're taking this. Loomis opens a notebook.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Donna, was Jack worried about anything? (Donna shakes her head) Did he have any enemies?

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: You have some nerve. Enemies? (indicates Tony, bitterly) Ask your partner. Ask his father. Everybody heard him in court, how he threatened Jack's life. That bastard makes parole and two months later.. TWO MONTHS LATER! Donna breaks down. She can't go on.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: All right, Donna. We'll talk tomorrow. This is Officer Geary. He's gonna make sure you get home.  17. A UNIFORM COP gently leads Donna away. Delgetty turns to Tony and Loomis. CAPT. DELGETTY (CONT’D) For the record. I'm not yelling.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: You never yell. I wish you would.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: We need this in the bag. Immediately. She was right about your old man. We've got to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Iwill. I'll do it. He's coming to my kid's baseball game. (to Loomis) Can you cover the autopsy? I'll meet you back in the war room. Loomis nods. Tony starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: Detective. (Tony turns) Big Tony. It's not possible, is it? Tony considers this.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LITTLE LEAGUE FIELD- DAY
dialogues.text: A LITTLE LEAGUE GAME is in progress. Tony is behind the plate, umpiring, with his old-fashioned BALL AND STRIKE CLICKER. A QUICK MONTAGE: Tony calling pitches.. calling plays, et He carefully, obsessively sweeps off home plate.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE STANDS- SAME TIME
dialogues.text: In the stands, watching this: Tony's ex wife, KAYLA, and partner, AVERY. They're newlyweds. Both smart professionals.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: I still can't picture it. You and him.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: It wasn't all terrible. The house was always clean. Look at home plate. That was our house. Kayla gestures "blowing her brains out". Big Tony appears juggling BEER and HOT DOGS.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: (to OTHER PARENTS) Can I sit here? We're family. Thank you. Big Tony squeezes in. He and Kayla and Avery exchange chilly, awkward greetings. BIG TONY (CONT’D) Has he been up?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Twice.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: How'd he do? Wait, don't tell me. Ignorance is bliss.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: If ignorance were bliss, Tony, you'd be having orgasms all day.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Maybe I am. (yelling, playfully)

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LITTLE LEAGUE FIELD- DAY
dialogues.text: Tony tries to ignore HIS OWN FATHER HECKLING HIM.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE STEVIE WONDER
dialogues.text: The BATTER pops out.  19.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: He's out. (to Kayla & Avery) Just like you guys.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LITTLE LEAGUE FIELD- DAY
dialogues.text: The game continues. The next batter is EVAN, Tony and Kayla's son.

dialogues.speaker: COME ON, EVAN
dialogues.text: I can't look. Evan takes a pitch.

dialogues.speaker: BALL ONE
dialogues.text: (quietly, to Evan) Good eye, buddy. Wait for your pitch. The next pitch. Evan connects! The FIRST BASEMAN fields t ball. It's a funny, sloppy play; typical little league stuff. Evan dodges the tag. The First Baseman chases him around. Finally, somehow, Evan reaches first base. He's safe!

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You're OUT! Out?!? A confused beat.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Dad!? He missed me by a mile!

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You were out of the baseline. Sorry, buddy. The PARENTS BOO. The PLAYERS BOO. EVERYONE BOOS.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you break one rule, what happens? That's right. They all break.  20.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE STANDS- SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Kayla, the ex-wife, knows what's coming.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Oh no. Not the rulebook..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony takes out a RULE BOOK. The LOUD BOOING continues.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Here it is. 15 J. "A batter/runner cannot deviate more than 3 feet from the baseline while avoiding the tag". Evan sighs, and sulks away.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good hit though. Way to hustle.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LITTLE LEAGUE FIELD- LATER
dialogues.text: The game is over. The PLAYERS are collecting their stuff. Kayla and Avery step up. Tony and the women exchange tens overly-polite greetings. Divorces are tough.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Could I see that rule book? I'm just curious. Kayla takes the RULE BOOK.. and playfully FOLDS it.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh look. It bends. Unlike the umpire.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I get it. Very cute. Well, I think he learned a valuable lesson.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Oh we ALL learned a lesson, Tony. How's tomorrow morning?  21.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I'll have to call you. An ex cop was killed, so it's all hands on deck.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Well, let me know. Kayla and Avery & Evan walk away. Big Tony IMPROVISES a sweet goodbye with his grandson. Then he crosses to Tony.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: An ex cop?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I was about to tell you. It was Jack Livingston. They found him this morning in Ambrose Park.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It wasn't pretty. Abducted. Drugged. Suffocated. Then shot.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have done it in that order, but still-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Jesus! Dad!

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna lie to you. I have mixed feelings here.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Where would you start?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: If it was my case? I'd be looking at me. Tony gestures, "be serious". BIG TONY (CONT’D) Why not? Who has a better motive? I did 12 birthdays inside for that bastard. (grins) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe I'm your blind spot. Every cop has one.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Are you gonna help me here or not?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Livingston took five other cops down with me. Every one of ‘em told me they'd take him out if they could.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You believe them?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: I did at the time. But that was 12 years ago. Grudges have a way of, what's the word?- dissipating.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I heard he was broke. I heard he owed the Newmark Brothers.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: They're serious people. But what you described- abducted, drugged, shot- it doesn't sound like business. It sounds personal. Have you met the wife?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Donna.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: She's a real people-pleaser. Half of Brooklyn would love a ride on that pony. (chuckles ) You've got your work cut out for you. There won't be a lot of tears at that funeral.

dialogues.speaker: ALL-CITY SQUAD ROOM- 15TH PRECINCT- NIGHT
dialogues.text: The All City Task Force occupies a LARGE ATTIC-LOFT of th old precinct building. Old school. Wooden desks. Piles of case files. These detectives are overworked and underfund  23. A CASE BOARD dominates the room. It says "LIST OF POSSIBLES". Underneath: 14 HEADSHOTS of assorted local lowlifes. Meet RYAN Earnest. an iPAD.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: My old man was right. Bookies, cops, ex cops, gangbangers. Half the borough had it in for this guy.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Lieutenant? Dr. Zee just posted the autopsy. DOMKI, the squad's civilian technician. 20's. Eager to please.. a little TOO eager. He holds up

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I can't read it from here, Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. (reading) "Name of deceased: Jack Livingston. Well nourished male Caucasian. 178 pounds. Height, 70 inches.."

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Ryan, Ryan, I just need the headlines. Time of death?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Sorry. "Between 4 PM Saturday and 4 AM Sunday."

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That's a pretty big window.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: He had eight mills of nembutal in his blood. Probably injected with a syringe.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: They jacked him up before they killed him.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yes sir. That's my conclusion as well. (resumes ) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "C.0.D.: acute asphyxia." That would be the plastic bag. Then, postmortem, five gunshots, 9 millimeter, upper chest.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Five shots after he died. Cowboy? What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Sound premeditated. (then) Back in the day, a case like this, I'd run it past your old man. (to Ryan) Big Tony was the best street cop I ever knew. Every morning, they'd be four, five detectives outside his office, waiting to run their cases past him.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: He thinks we should look at the wife.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Rings true to me. The first time I met Donna Livingston she was dancing at a club by the airport and her name was Dory-Anne. This was two dead husbands ago. During this, faintly- BEEP BEEP BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell? Ryan proudly indicates his HIGH-TECH WRIST WATCH.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: That's me. It's called the VitaLink. I'm beta testing it for a friend. It has a skin sensor on the back. It reads your hydration level.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: It's a watch that tells you when you're thirsty?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I guess, yeah. Pretty much.  25. The stupid watch continues to BEEP BEEP BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Does it tell you when you're being a douchbag? (BEEP BEEP BEEP..)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer is yes. BEEP BEEP BEEP. Ryan can't turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just take it off.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Maybe if I.. Ryan gulps down some water, trying to turn it off. BEEP B BEEP BEEP..

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: If I killed you right now, no jury in the world would convict me. Finally, somehow, the watch stops.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Hey. Guys. We're on the job. Let's do the job. Ryan, check the phone records- his and hers. Make sure the DA's office is looped in. Cowboy, turn these guys over, check their alibis. We've gotta start clearing this board. Capt. Delgetty enters. She looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Captain?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: A few years back, during the troubles, we started stamping every round of ammunition that we issued, so every bullet discharged could be traced back to the officer who fired it. She holds up an EVIDENCE BAG containing FIVE SLUGS. CAPT. DELGETTY (CONT’D) These are the slugs they just pulled out of Jack Livingston. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPT. DELGETTY (CONT’D) I was there. They never left my sight. (beat) They're all stamped. They're department issued.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You're saying.. a cop did this?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: They were issued to this unit. To one specific officer. She hands Tony a CLIPBOARD. A tense, expectant beat.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (reading list, baffled) It's me.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: Lt. Caruso, I need you to surrender your weapon. And follow me. DEAD SILENCE. Tony, stunned, unholsters his Glock and han it to her. Then- BEEP BEEP. It's Ryan's stupid watch.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Sorry. Ryan drinks water, frantically, trying to turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: INT. POLICE BALLISTICS LAB- MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Later. They're testing Tony's weapon. A POLICE TECHNICIAN fits and locks the gun into a metallic vice, then attache wire to the trigger. Capt. Delgetty and Tony watch, anxiously. Everyone puts on ear-protectors. BLAM! A bullet is fired into a TESTING CHAMBER filled with ORDINANCE GELITAN. The Technician digs the bullet from the gelitan, washes i off, and places it in a COMPARISON MICROSCOPE. MICROSCOPE POV: The two bullets. Side by side. They're rotated until the grooves and striations line up.  27. The Technician looks up, concerned. Tony steps up to the microscope, and looks for himself. He reacts, stunned. They're identical.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CONFERENCE ROOM- POLICE STATION- LATER
dialogues.text: Later. Tony is being questioned by Captain Delgetty and QUINN, a skeptical officer from Internal Affairs. Sitting beside Tony is a POLICE UNION REP.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR QUINN
dialogues.text: Has everyone been sworn? Note the time. (starting a TAPE RECORDER) I am Matthew Quinn, Senior Inspector, Internal Affairs. I'm here with Capt. R.H. Delgetty. We're talking to Detective Anthony Caruso. Detective, is there anything you'd like to tell us?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: There's been a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR QUINN
dialogues.text: I hope you're right, son. Quinn indicates the Glock on the table, in an EVIDENCE BA INSPECTOR QUINN (CONT’D) We have your gun here. According to the ballistics, this is the weapon that killed Jack Livingston.

dialogues.speaker: UNION REP
dialogues.text: Excuse me. The union doesn't consider those results definitive. Lt. Caruso has a right to retest the weapon in an independent lab-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (overruling his own counsel) That won't be necessary. I'll stipulate the shots came from my gun. I ran the test myself, twice.

dialogues.speaker: UNION REP
dialogues.text: Ah.. I'd like to talk to Tony privately-  28.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: There's no need for that. We're all here for the same reason, right? We're trying to figure out what happened.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: Absolutely. We're just trying to figure this out.

dialogues.speaker: UNION REP
dialogues.text: Then let's start here: What possible motive could he have? He barely knew the victim.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR QUINN
dialogues.text: Family honor.

dialogues.speaker: UNION REP
dialogues.text: Family honor? Twelve years after the trial? Where does I.A. get the nerve? (waving a PRINT OUT) Have you seen his record? Not a single complaint. You could eat off this. You know what they call him around here?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: The Choirboy.

dialogues.speaker: UNION REP
dialogues.text: That's right. The Choirboy. He doesn't step out, he doesn't drink, he doesn't curse. Most cops I know won't work with him, he's such a Goddamn pain in the ass.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Thank you, Phil.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR QUINN
dialogues.text: We'll stipulate. It's an admirable record. (resuming) Let's talk about the weapon. When was it issued?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Eight years ago. Same day I got my shield. Best day of my life.  29.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR QUINN
dialogues.text: You keep it with you? Tony pats his EMPTY SHOULDER HOLSTER.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR QUINN
dialogues.text: Did you ever loan it to anyone?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR QUINN
dialogues.text: Did you ever lose track of it? For an hour? It happens.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Not to me.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: Tony, you said 24-7, but that's not really possible. When you take a shower. .?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It's on the counter by the sink. It's never out of my sight.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR QUINN
dialogues.text: You've got to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It's next to the bed. In my nightstand. In the top drawer.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR QUINN
dialogues.text: Is the drawer locked?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR QUINN
dialogues.text: Jack Livingston was killed some time on Saturday, possibly Sunday morning. We know where you were during the day. Tell us about Saturday night.  30.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I was at Dino's, watching the playoffs.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR QUINN
dialogues.text: Until when?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Ten thirty. Home by eleven, asleep by midnight. Life in the fast lane.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR QUINN
dialogues.text: Did you sleep alone?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR QUINN
dialogues.text: And the Glock was..?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: In the drawer. All night.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR QUINN
dialogues.text: You don't know that, do you? I mean, you were sleeping. Somebody could've taken it, and returned it two hours later. Tony considers this.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: You live with your father, don't you? BOOM. The question hits Tony like a hammer.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ALL-CITY SQUAD ROOM- LATER
dialogues.text: In the Squad Room. The CASE BOARD illustrates the episode baffling puzzle: Across the top it says: LIST OF POSSIBLES. Underneath are TWO HEADSHOTS. One of Tony. One of his father. Our two leads. It had to one of them. Loomis and Ryan look at the board. In shock.  31.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Help me Rhonda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining. Tony is walking to his car.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Caruso. Gabby is there. In the rain. Waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did they take your badge?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Not yet. Modified duty. I'm riding my desk, pending a departmental review. (pushing past her) I'm meeting somebody, so.. But Gabby stops him.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: I need a minute here. I just have to look you in the eye. (she does, intently) I can handle being wrong. I've been wrong before. But I have to know.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I don't know what happened, Gabby.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: You can talk to me. There's nobody else here.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I don't know what happened.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: I've been vouching for your father. I put my ass on the line.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I know you have.  32.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: My C.O. wants him back inside. Everybody does. But I've been vouching for him. Because.. I trust my gut. I think he has a good heart.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: You. He raised you. (then) If it was him, if he did this thing, I've never been wronger about anybody.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FRONT HALL- CARUSO HOUSE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Tony arrives home. He CALLS OUT-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Hello? Dad? No response.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LIVING ROOM- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Later. Tony is calling around, looking for his father.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (into PHONE) No, he's not there. Well if he checks in, tell him to call me. Tell him it's important. Tony hangs up. He sighs. He considers the WALL OF FAMILY PHOTOS. He focuses on a photo of CONNIE, his late mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning. In Queens. A BUSY INTERSECTION in a marginal neighborhood. A strip mall. Some apartment buildings. To the rest of the world, it's just another street corner To Tony and his father, it's sacred ground.  33. Tony parks. He climbs out carrying a BOUQUET OF FLOWERS. tapes the flowers to a streetlight. A makeshift memorial. He notices: ANOTHER BOUQUET, already there. Big Tony is sitting nearby, on a BUS STOP BENCH.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Have you been here all night? Big Tony gestures, "where else would I go?"

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Fourteen years tomorrow. Tony sits beside his father. He indicates the FLOWERS.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You gotta tape them up. They'll blow away.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Let 'em go. She never liked getting flowers. She hated watching them die. (re: APARTMENT BUILDING) How many people live there? Three hundred?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Maybe more.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Nobody saw anything? Or heard anything?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It was after midnight-

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: (bitterly) He dragged her fifty feet. He never even slowed down.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: The bank camera caught part of it.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: A yellow minivan, possible Jersey plates. That's nothing.  34.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It's something. It might be enough. I'll never stop looking, you know that.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: That sonofabitch better pray to God you find him before I do. Then, gingerly..

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Dad. We need to talk. Can we go someplace?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: We are someplace. What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I can't do it here. (then, giving in) Jack Livingston was killed with my gun.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Your Glock? That's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It's more that possible. It's a statement of fact.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: I'll ask around. I still got a lot of chips out there-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You can't ask around, Dad. They're looking at you.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Who's looking at me?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (pointedly) You threatened him. In public.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: I say things-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You threatened him on multiple occasions.  35.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: I say a lot of things. What are you- ? You come here? To this corner? This is sacred ground! Big Tony is too upset to continue. He walks away. He collects himself, then returns.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who am I talking to here, you or the badge?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I am the badge.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Let's be very careful here, Anthony. Let's not say anything we're not gonna regret. I've had people tuned up-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Dad-

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Maybe I tuned some people up myself. I don't deny that. But I never crossed the line. I never killed nobody. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Here's what I know. Livingston was shot sometime on Saturday with my gun- MY GUN- which was never out of my sight except while I slept. It's all about access, dad. The front door was locked. The back door was locked. The only people in the house were you and me.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: And Gunther.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (stunned) And.. Gunther?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET- CONSTRUCTION SIGHT- MORNING
dialogues.text: Downtown. A CITY CONSTRUCTION CREW is laying asphalt. We focus on one worker: GUNTHER WELLES. Amiable. Middle aged  36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A block away. Tony & Big Tony are parked in TONY'S SEDAN. It's a father-son stakeout.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (reading a RAP SHEET) Gunther Luther Welles. A couple of jolts, nothing major. Resisting arrest, possession with intent. How do you know this jerk?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: We used to work together. Stealing copper wire from construction sites.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: And you don't feel any shame?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Shame isn't one of my virtues.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Virtue isn't one of your virtues. So, Saturday night..?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Saturday night. You went to bed, what, midnight? I stayed up. I was watching the Food Network.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I know what you were watching, Dad. I get the bill.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: I call it the Food Network. Quarter to one. Ding dong. It's my old pal, Gunther. He's having a tough year. He's been living with his sister. They had a fight, something. She kicked him out. He needed a bed. At the car window: a DELIVERY KID appears with a BAG OF F

dialogues.speaker: DELIVERY KID
dialogues.text: Caruso?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Right here.  37.

dialogues.speaker: DELIVERY KID
dialogues.text: That's $12.50. Big Tony takes the BAG. Unwraps it. It's a calzone.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: From Brody's Deli. Best calzone in the city.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: We're on a stakeout. You can't have food delivered!

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: You really have a lot to learn. (gesturing "money") Do you have any..? Tony sighs and pays for the food.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: So Gunther Welles..?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: We talked for an hour. I went upstairs. He crashed on the red couch in basement.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: And he was there all night?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: As far as I know. He was there when I woke up. You must've missed him.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ALL-CITY SQUAD ROOM- DAY
dialogues.text: Back in the Squad Room. Our team is assembled: Tony, Loom and Ryan. Gabby has joined them, too. Ryan adds GUNTHER WELLES' PHOTO to the CASE BOARD. Finall they have a third suspect.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Thanks for inviting me.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: A fresh set of eyes, always helpful.  38.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Gunther Welles? Never heard of him. Does he have anything resembling a motive?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact.. (reading from iPAD) He had an uncle, Martin Welles. AKA Manny Corkrin, AKA Manny DeAngelos. Uncle Marty was arrested, 1998, possession with intent. Guess who the arresting officer was.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Jack Livingston.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Uncle Manny drew 5 to 10 and died in prison.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I know it's thin.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: I wish I was that thin.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It's something. It's a connection.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Let's play it out. For kicks and giggles. Here's your house.. Gabby crosses to a DRY ERASE BOARD. She sketches a crude FLOOR PLAN of a three-story house.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is you. This is your dad. She draws TWO STICK FIGURES asleep in bed.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gunther Welles is in the basement. At some point after one AM, he sneaks upstairs. He finds your room. He enters your room. He finds your gun..  39.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: In the dark. Without waking you up.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I have a sound machine.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: A sound machine. God help us.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: He sneaks out of the house. He finds Jack Livingston, drugs him, strangles him, shoots him five times, then carries the body to Ambrose Park and dumps it by the trail. They're interrupted. BEEP BEEP BEEP. It's Ryan's awful watch. Loomis grabs a PITCHER OF WATER.. crosses to Ryan.. and calmly pours water onto Ryans's hand, drowning the watch.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Not cool, man.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: (resuming) Ambrose Park..?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: He dumps the body, then sneaks back into the house, locks the door behind him, returns the gun, then goes back downstairs. Everyone considers this.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: The DA's never gonna buy it.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It's all we've got. It was my gun. Nothing else makes sense.  40.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: You people aren't even asking the right question. Has anyone read this? He holds up an AUTOPSY DIAGRAM of the BULLET-RIDDLED BODY

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: None of these bullets passed through the body, so the shooter had to be at least 20 yards away. Look at that grouping. From 20 yards? Who is this guy, Daniel Boone? Where'd he learn to shoot?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: He's not ex-military.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Has he ever fired a gun in his life?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Can we ask him?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: We can ask but it won't do any good.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: The golden rule, kid. The first thing every homicide investigator learns-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Murderers lie.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Murderers. Lie. They're stumped. Then-

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: I have an idea. (to Tony) You're not gonna like it.  41.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DINO'S BAR- NEXT DAY
dialogues.text: The joint is quiet, nearly empty. Tony, Gabby and Loomis at a table with their suspect, Gunther Welles. They're having a friendly chat. Laughs. Drinks. A CLASSIC ROCK SONG plays.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: I love the old songs. Why doesn't anybody write old songs anymore? Loomis fills Gunther's glass.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTHER WELLES
dialogues.text: I've been braced before, but never like this.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You're a friend of my father's. You get the VIP treatment.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTHER WELLES
dialogues.text: You can buy me drinks till the moon turns blue, it won't change my story.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: We're just talking, Gunther. A friendly chat. You were telling us about your Uncle Manny..

dialogues.speaker: GUNTHER WELLES
dialogues.text: Like I said. He was a mean old prick. I'm surprised his own shadow kept him company. During this, TWO BADASS GANGSTERS enter the bar. They loo around, warily. THEY'RE CASING THE PLACE.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: You weren't angry when he died? In prison? Alone?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: You didn't hold anyone responsible?

dialogues.speaker: GUNTHER WELLES
dialogues.text: Why should I?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Okay. We'll come back to that. Let's talk about Saturday night.  42.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTHER WELLES
dialogues.text: Nothing to tell. My sister brought a guy home and they kicked me out. It happens every few weeks. I knocked on a few doors and ended up in your basement.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Sorry about the smell, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTHER WELLES
dialogues.text: Hell, I'm up to my ass in asphalt all day. Nothing bothers me.

dialogues.speaker: NOBODY MOVE
dialogues.text: The GANGSTERS pull their GUNS! EVERYONE TENSES, FREEZES. FIRST GANGSTER (CONT’D) The drawer.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: We just opened. There won't be much.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GANGSTER
dialogues.text: We'll take what you have.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Hey. Douchebag. You know where you are?

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GANGSTER
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: This is Dinos. It's a cop bar. We're all blue.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GANGSTER
dialogues.text: Well. That makes it even sweeter. While everyone is distracted, the Bartender pulls a SAWED from under the bar.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: The Bartender FIRES! BLAM! The SECOND GANGSTER collapses, dead.  43. ALL HELL BREAKS LOOSE! The FIRST GANGSTER spins, fires! BLAM BLAM! The Bartender collapses. He's dead. Gabby and Loomis scramble and return fire! BLAM BLAM! Gunther cowers behind the table. BLAM! Loomis is SHOT IN THE CHEST. He collapses. He's dead. You read that right. Loomis is dead. As he falls, his SERVICE REVOLVER- a Glock 19- flies loose and slides across the floor. It stops near Gunther.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into CELLPHONE)

dialogues.speaker: DOWN
dialogues.text: The gunfight continues. BLAM BLAM! GABBY IS SHOT. She collapses. She's dead. Tony is shot, too. He's hit in the chest, seriously wounded. Then it's over. The aftermath: blood and bodies everywher The Surviving Gangster crosses.. menacingly.. toward Tony

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GANGSTER
dialogues.text: Sorry brother. Gotta finish it. No witnesses. He AIMS AT TONY. Tony braces himself. This is the end. Bu CLICK!- the gun is empty. The Gangster starts to reload. Gunther, of all people, is the last man standing. He's st cowering behind the table. LOOMIS'S GLOCK is within reach

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Gunther! The gun! GRAB THE GUN!

dialogues.speaker: DO IT
dialogues.text: Gunther grabs Loomis's gun. He stands. He's shaking. He fumbles with the safety, closes his eyes and- BLAM BLAM!- FIRES WILDLY! The recoil sends him flying backwards! A beat. Then.. Tony sits up.. unhurt! The gunshots were fake. BODY SQUIB Loomis and Gabby sit up. The Bartender and the Gangster stand. IT WAS ALL STAGED. They applaud each other's "performance".

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All those improv classes finally paid off.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTHER WELLES
dialogues.text: What's going on..?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (introducing the "Gangsters" ) Gunther Welles, meet Lt. Marson and Sgt. Diaz.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: We were testing you, Gunther. This is a Glock 19. The same model as the murder weapon. You've never fired a gun in your life, have you? (Gunther shakes his head) I didn't think so. (to Tony) Now we know. Suddenly- BAM!- Loomis is "Shot" again. Another SQUIB CHA ON HIS CHEST explodes. Ryan appears, holding a SFX CONTROL BOX. He's been the "stunt coordinator", controlling SQUIB CHARGES from behin the bar.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Sorry. BAM! Another SQUIB on Loomis explodes. Ryan pretends the controller is broken.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (mock surprise) Sorry. Sorry. I think it's stuck.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Cut it out, kid. I mean it. It's not funny..

dialogues.speaker: INT. SQUAD ROOM- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Later. Tony is in the Squad Room. Alone. He studies the LIST OF POSSIBLES on the CASE BOARD. GUNTHER'S PHOTO has been moved to the bottom. He's been eliminated. So.. they're back to TWO SUSPECTS. TWO PHOTOS. One of Ton One of his father. Gabby appears in the doorway, carrying her MOTORCYCLE HEL and a BOTTLE OF WINE.  45.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: You can't avoid it forever.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Going home.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (ruefully) You should be a detective.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: I'm thinking about it. There's an exam in March.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: So am I. If you can do it, how hard can it be? Gabby sits. She makes herself comfortable. She pours herself a glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (ve: the CASE BOARD) We're back where we started. You'll have to testify.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I am aware. As always, Tony is playing BOSSA NOVA music.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Bossa nova?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It helps me think.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: (offering the BOTTLE) You want some of this? It helps me NOT think. (Tony demurs) I forgot. The Choirboy. Gabby considers Tony's carefully organized desk. She pick up a PILE OF REPORTS and MIXES THEM UP.  46.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! No don't- Gabby! (sighing, fixing his desk) Why do you torture me?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: I can't resist. You're so.. damn.. good. I bet you don't pee in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Do you want me to pee in the shower? Would that make you happy? Their eyes meet. Tony considers her, warmly. Tony nods.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How was your childhood?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: How was my childhood? (a painful subject) I didn't really have one. Thanks for asking. How was yours?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Outstanding, until my mother died. Whatever we needed, whatever we wanted, the old man took care of it. Diamond Tony Caruso. A house in Florida. A new car every year. Seats behind the dugout..

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: And you never suspected?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I never asked.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: You were afraid to ask. She's right again.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What about your mom?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I think she knew. She had to know.  47.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: They don't wash off easily, do they?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: The sins of the father.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KITCHEN- CARUSO HOUSE- DAWN
dialogues.text: Later. Tony arrives home. He starts upstairs. Big Tony appears. He's been waiting up. Both men are guarded. Suspicious of the other.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: I was worried.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: About who? This, of course, is THE question. A tense beat.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Gunther told me he's been officially cleared.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: We'll talk about it later. Come here. Big Tony embraces his son. They HUG. Tightly. Big Tony pats Tony's back. He pats Tony's lower back. Then he pats Tony's chest. Pat pat pat. HE'S LOOKING FOR A WIRE. Defiantly, Tony removes his shirt and his undershirt. He stands there, exposed, to prove he's not wired.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's some tortellini in the fridge.  48.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I'm good. See you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I love you, too. Tony walks into his bedroom, and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DONNA LIVINGSTON'S HOUSE- STATEN ISLAND- DAY
dialogues.text: A modest house on Staten Island. A cop's house. DOZENS OF CARS parked out front. FAMILY AND MOURNERS are arriving.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LIVINGSTON HOUSE- LIVING ROOM- DAY
dialogues.text: Inside. A MEMORIAL RECEPTION is in progress. On a table: display of PHOTOS memorializing Jack Livingston. The house is crowded with SOMBER MOURNERS. Some are FAMIL Some are COPS. Donna Livingston, the grieving widow, sits and quietly receives them.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS MOURNERS
dialogues.text: It was a beautiful service... Sorry for your loss.. (etc)

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY UNCLE
dialogues.text: Do they know who did it?

dialogues.speaker: DONNA LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: (bitterly) They know exactly who did it. They have all the evidence they need. (LOUDLY, to the room) But they're too chickenshit to do anything.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY UNCLE
dialogues.text: Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: I don't care who hears me!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FRONT DOOR- HALLWAY
dialogues.text: At the door. Tony arrives. Loomis intercepts him.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Are you mental? What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I had to show up. How would it look?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: It would look like you had some common sense. Donna's on the warpath. She's threatening to call the Post.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What does she want?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: She wants an arrest. Yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: My father?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Or you. Or both. She doesn't seem particular. (sighs ) All right. But stay out of the way. Stay in the bathroom. Donna has a NASTY DOG. It GROWLS and SNARLS at Tony.

dialogues.speaker: TEN YEAR OLD NIECE
dialogues.text: (pulling the DOG away) Maisy! No! She's like that with everybody, until she gets to know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reception continues. SHOTS OF MOURNERS talking quietl drinking. Maisy the dog SNARLS at various guests. Tony is in the kitchen, sipping ginger ale, trying to be inconspicuous. A FAMILY MEMBER walks past.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: How you doing? The Family Member doesn't respond. Tony is a leper.  50.

dialogues.speaker: ON DONNA
dialogues.text: Across the room: Donna Livingston is with her linebacker- BROTHER. She notices Tony.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: He's got nerve, I'll give him that.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA'S BROTHER
dialogues.text: You want me to- ?

dialogues.speaker: DONNA LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: No no. Not here.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: The reception continues. Capt. Delgetty and Loomis talk privately.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: This is the damndest case I ever saw. Diamond Tony Caruso was crooked as hell, but he was a first- rate detective. Why would he use that gun? He knew we could trace it back to his own house. It doesn't make sense.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: A lot of things don't make sense. Why are pennies bigger than dimes?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: I guess that's true..

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Why does Hawaii have an Interstate highway?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: You have a good point..

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Why doesn't Tarzan have a beard?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: (losing her patience) I don't know.  51.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Why did the Flintstones celebrate Christmas?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: When are you retiring?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: 474 days.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. DELGETTY
dialogues.text: Including today?

dialogues.speaker: INT. LIVING ROOM- SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Across the room. SGT. CHET FINCH- who we met earlier- is talking to SOME RELATIVES. Finch has a rash; he absentmindedly scratches his ankle.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FINCH
dialogues.text: I've never been up this way. Nice area.

dialogues.speaker: FRIENDLY AUNT
dialogues.text: I remember when Jack and Donna moved in, it was all woods.. They improvise a friendly conversation. During this, Donn dog AFFECTIONATELY RUBS AGAINST FINCH. Finch pets the dog They obviously know each other.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FINCH
dialogues.text: (to the dog) Hey sweetheart. I miss you too. Across the room: Tony is clocking this.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LIVING ROOM- MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: The reception continues. At one point, Donna walks upstai No one notices. A beat. Sgt. Finch excuses himself, then nonchalantly follows Donna up the stairs. Tony has been watching them. He casually follows them, up the stairs..  52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donna and Chet Finch are lovers. They're in an UPSTAIRS BEDROOM. Whispering. Embracing. Kissing hungrily.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: Chet.. what are you doing? We agreed.. we have to wait.. Tony opens the door. They break off, startled.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Knock knock.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FINCH
dialogues.text: Caruso- ?!

dialogues.speaker: DONNA LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: Are you lost?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (pointedly) I was lost. I'm not quite as lost as I was.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FINCH
dialogues.text: (recovering) Donna's an old friend. She needed to talk..

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Obviously. Finch SCRATCHES HIS LEG AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you okay, Sergeant? You've been scratching your leg all night.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FINCH
dialogues.text: It's a rash.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: From here, it looks like poison sumac. (then, accusingly) How did you do it?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FINCH
dialogues.text: Do what?  53.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Kill Jack Livingston with my gun. Before the couple can respond, Loomis appears.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Tony- !

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Cowboy! Is the Captain still here?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: She sent me to find you-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (excitedly) He's the guy. They're in it together! I don't know how they did it, but they did it-

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Tony-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Remember the poison sumac by the clearing? Check his left leg, they can match it in the lab-

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Tony- Tony- it's over.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (finally focusing) What's over?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: The case. They're closing it. (then) Your father just confessed.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STATE PRISON- VISITING AREA- LATER
dialogues.text: Tony is visiting his father. Big Tony is in prison overal He's doing what a good parent does: he's masking his fear and reassuring his son..

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: You don't remember Harry Corkrin? Harry The Horse? He's practically your Godfather. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's two cells over. I got more friends in here than I do outside. During this, Big Tony is shamelessly smoking a CIGAR.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You can't smoke in here.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: No. YOU can't smoke in here. (resuming) Plus I'm eating better. Plus I don't have to listen to your fakakta bossa nova. Don't worry about me, kid. The devil watches over his own.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You didn't answer my question. Why'd you sign that statement?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Because I did it. I killed him.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: You're a good cop, Tony. But you're not a father. (heartfelt) I'd take a bullet for you. Don't you know that? (clarifying) Not in the gut. The leg maybe. A flesh wound. Or the thigh. A PRISON GUARD appears, as a waiter would, with a MUG OF COFFEE. BIG TONY (CONT’D) Thank you, Corey. Is there any of that cinnamon? The GUARD adds some cinnamon to the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You think I did it? You think you're protecting me?  55.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: (gesturing: people might hear) Hey.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I didn't kill anybody.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Of course you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It wasn't either of us. It was Chet Finch!

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Finch?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: And Livingston's wife. They planned it together.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: With your gun? (beat) How? Tony doesn't know. He doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STATE PRISON- VISITOR PARKING- LATER
dialogues.text: Moments later. Tony is leaving the prison. He drives out the VISITOR PARKING LOT. He doesn't notice: Sgt. Finch is parked nearby. Tony driv away. Finch follows him.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KITCHEN- CARUSO HOME- LATER
dialogues.text: That night. Tony and his son, Evan, are in the KITCHEN. Evan is staring, glumly, at a slice of PIZZA.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You have to eat. I promised your mom.  56.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: What are these?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Olives. Evan removes the BLACK OLIVES. He places them on a white platter, one at a time.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you ever had one? Let's try one. Let's be brave.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: I don't want to be brave.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Well, that's probably a sign of intelligence. Tony considers the FIVE BLACK OLIVES on the white platter THE PATTERN LOOKS FAMILIAR. Tony rearranges them. Suddenly- AN IDEA! Tony excitedly finds the CASE FILE and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Tony is distracted. Focusing on the file.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I think you might have just solved my case! Get your coat. I'm taking you home.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BROOKLYN- STREET CORNER- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Moments later. Gabby is waiting on a street corner. Tony comes SCREECHING UP in his car. He flings open the door-

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: What couldn't wait?  57.

dialogues.speaker: INT./EXT. TONY'S CAR- DRIVING- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Gabby & Tony in Tony's car. They're speeding north, towar the Bronx.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I need someone to tell me if I'm crazy.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: You're not crazy, Caruso. You're just rebelling against a father who you love but could never count on or trust-

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Not me. The case. I think I know who shot Jack Livingston.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Who was it?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I think it was me. I shot him, but I didn't know I shot him.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Ask me if you're crazy again.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It was a set up. Gabby, it was brilliant. It was a work of art..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tony explains, we SEE THE CRIME IN A STYLIZED BLACK & WHITE FLASHBACK.. Jack Livingston is in bed, fast asleep. Donna is injectin him with a HYPODERMIC NEEDLE. Her lover, Sgt. Chet Finch, nearby, watching.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (VO)
dialogues.text: It was Finch and Donna Livingston. They jacked him up, probably while he slept..

dialogues.speaker: INT. TONY'S CAR- DRIVING- NIGHT- PRESENT DAY
dialogues.text: Resume present day. In Tony's car-  58.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: At some point, later that day, they killed him with the trash bag. Suffocation. Then- and this is the brilliant part- they brought the body to Rodman's Neck.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Rodman's Neck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FLASHBACKS RESUME. We're back where the episode start at the OUTDOOR POLICE TRAINING FACILITY.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (VO)
dialogues.text: It's a training facility in the Bronx. We have to go every year to get recertified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're "backstage" at the shooting range, behind the woode targets. Finch and Donna are strapping LIVINGSTON'S BODY the BACK OF A LIFESIZE WOODEN TARGET.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (VO)
dialogues.text: Finch is the on-site supervisor. He knew I was scheduled to shoot that day, at 5:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the first scene in the episode? We replay it now Tony is at the practice range. A LIFESIZE PAPER TARGET ro into view. Tony fires! BLAM BLAM BLAM BLAM BLAM! Five shots. A tight cluster, around the heart. Except NOW we see BEHIND the target. LIVINGSTON'S BODY IS STRAPPED UPRIGHT TO THE BOARD. It's a horrific image. The bullets pass through the wood, and riddle the lifeless bo

dialogues.speaker: GABBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh my God!  59.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (VO)
dialogues.text: They knew my old man would be suspect number one. The ballistic test would seal the deal.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TONY'S CAR- DRIVING- NIGHT- PRESENT DAY
dialogues.text: RESUME PRESENT DAY. Gabby and Tony in Tony's car.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: So you killed him?!

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No no no no no no. He was already dead, remember? Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: When did you figure all this? Tony hands her the BODY DIAGRAM from Livingston's autopsy The FIVE BULLET HOLES are clearly marked.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I knew that cluster pattern looked familiar.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Wait. Hold on. You remembered the pattern of the bullets holes, from, like, ten days ago?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I guess I did.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: From one target? Out of how many, twenty? Caruso, that's not normal. That's pretty freaky.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It's a pretty distinctive pattern. It's an almost perfect hexagon-

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: A perfect hexagon? It's five random holes. You're a freak of nature, Caruso. You're like Rainman-  60.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (interrupting, annoyed) Excuse me. I have a plan. Would you like to know where we're going?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: To Professor Xavier's mansion, to pick up the other mutants?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That's right. We're going to Professor Xavier's mansion to pick up the other mutants. Tony's car continues north. They don't notice: SGT. FINCH'S CAR, a block behind, following them...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. POLICE TRAINING FACILITY- BRONX- FRONT GATE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: It's late. The facility is closed. Tony's car approaches the FRONT GATE. Tony knows the security code and punches it in. The gate swings open.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TRAINING FACILITY- MAIN OFFICE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Moments later. The MAIN OFFICE is empty and dark. Tony an Gabby are looking around.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Maybe he threw it out.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: They're supposed to keep them here for ten days, until they're officially recorded. Here they are. They've found an OVERSIZE BIN filled with USED PAPER SILHOUETTE TARGETS.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. POLICE TRAINING FACILITY- FRONT GATE- SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Out front. Sgt. Finch arrives!  61.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TRAINING FACILITY- MAIN OFFICE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Inside. Tony and Gabby are still searching through the PA TARGETS. Until..

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: "May 24. Caruso, Junior". She pulls out the BULLET-RIDDLED TARGET. Tony has brought the AUTOPSY DIAGRAM. They compare the pattern of holes. Tony was right. They're identical.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wow. Is that enough?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It's more than enough. It's incontrovertible. Gabby starts to roll up the target.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't touch it. We have to preserve the chain of evidence. We'll come back tomorrow with a warrant.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: At least take a picture. Gabby takes a QUICK PHOTO of the paper target.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PARKING LOT- TRAINING FACILITY- MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Tony & Gabby walk back to Tony's car.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Were you serious about taking the exam?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Are you hiring?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Maybe we are. I could talk to the Captain. Suddenly they stop. The hood of Tony's car is open. The DISTRIBUTOR CAP has been ripped out.  62.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FINCH'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Right there. Right there. They turn. Sgt. Finch is pointing a GUN at them.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FINCH
dialogues.text: First your phones. Let's drop them. Tony and Gabby slowly take out their CELL PHONES, and dro them.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You don't want to do this, Chet. You're not a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: (reminding him) He is a murderer. That's why we're here.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FINCH
dialogues.text: Now your guns. You first. Tony opens his jacket. No holster. No gun.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FINCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (gloating) Oh I forgot. It's in the evidence room. It is, after all, a murder weapon. (then) Inspector? Gabby opens her jacket. No weapon.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: I left it home.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FINCH
dialogues.text: Why would you do that? You're on the job.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: When he called, all he said was he wanted to see me. (embarrassed) I thought he was asking me out.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (surprised, flattered) Really?  63. Now we reveal: Gabby really DOES have a gun! It's holster behind her, out of sight. She SLOWLY REACHES FOR IT, as..

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FINCH
dialogues.text: I thought I covered every angle. How did you figure it?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: He remembered the pattern of the bullet holes.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FINCH
dialogues.text: From one target? From ten days ago? It's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: That's what I said!

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It was a unique pattern. It's an almost perfect hexagon- (to Gabby) Was that true? You thought I was asking you out?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: No. Sorry. Suddenly Gabby pulls her GUN- spins- and BLAM!- fires at Finch! Finch DIVES OUT THE WAY! Tony & Gabby scramble awa They race toward the OUTDOOR TARGET RANGE..

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TARGET RANGE- CONTINUOUS- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Tony and Gabby run through the dark, quiet, sprawling TAR RANGE. Past PROP BUILDINGS and WOODEN CARS. It's other- worldly. Suddenly- FLOOD LIGHTS! The range is bathed in light. Ton and Gabby are exposed! BLAM BLAM! Finch fires at them! But from where? Tony and Gabby scramble away. Now the TARGETS are switche on! A MECHANICAL GOON SWINGS into view. TWANGGG! Gabby spins, fires! BLAM BLAM! More TARGETS POP UP! TWANGGGG!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat and mouse. They stalk each other.. warily, silently. Tony hides behind a MECHANICAL TARGET. Suddenly it SWINGS AWAY! Oh shit! He's exposed! Finch fires- BLAM BLAM! Tony dives away just in time!

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND A WOODEN CAR
