dialogues.text: Tony and Gabby take cover behind a WOODEN CAR. BLAM BLAM! Shots whiz past them! They're pinned down. They huddle together. They're close. They're touching.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Jiminy Cricket!

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: "Jiminy Cricket"? This is a gunfight, Caruso. You're allowed to curse.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Give me the gun.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: I got him.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Give me the gun. I'ma better shot.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Because you're a guy? Tony grabs the gun from her. He checks the clip. It's almost empty.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Do you have another clip? Gabby shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: How many rounds?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: One.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Make it count.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You think?  65.

dialogues.speaker: WITH FINCH- BEHIND A FACADE
dialogues.text: Twenty yards away: Finch is hiding behind a facade. Finch hears: CLICK CLICK CLICK. It's obviously Tony, tryi to fire his gun, which is empty. CLICK CLICK. Finch smirks. He confidently steps into the open. Tony is standing there, in the open, holding the empty weapon. It continues to CLICK CLICK CLICK. Finch raises his gun. He's about to execute Tony. But-— BLAM! Tony's gun ISN'T empty! He had one round left. He shot Finch in the shoulder. Finch falls, wounded. He drops his gun. It's all over. Tony kicks Finch's gun away. Gabby joins him. Finch looks at Tony, defeated, baffled. Now Tony reveals how he made the CLICKING sound: he's hol the UMPIRE'S BALL AND STRIKE COUNTER. CLICK CLICK CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STATE PRISON- LOUNGE AREA- NEXT DAY
dialogues.text: In a common room. SOME PRISONERS, including Big Tony, are watching the news. ON THE MONITOR: a perp walk. Sgt. Finc and Donna Livingston are being led into a police station.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER'S VOICE, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: The victim's widow and Sergeant Chet Finch are being held without bail. They're both charged with conspiracy and aggravated homicide... Big Tony grins.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: I guess I better start packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across town. Gabby is at her desk. She's taking a practic test for the NYPD DETECTIVE'S EXAM..  66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile. In Queens. Tony has returned to the corner whe his mother was killed. He studies the crime scene like the great cop he is. The traffic. The apartment building. The strip mall. The line of sight. He's obsessed with the case. It's a wound that will never heal.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STATE PRISON- PRISONER RELEASE AREA- DAY
dialogues.text: The next day. At the STATE PRISON. The BIG GATE slides open. Big Tony emerges, carrying his personal effects bag Tony is standing beside his car, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: (beaming) This never gets old.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Me, getting sprung, you, here, waiting for me. It makes me think I did something right. They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I told you not to worry.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: I wasn't worried for a minute. I had the second best cop in New York history on the case. The two Carusos climb into the car. Tony drives away. They go ten feet. There's a rusty, faded old sign: STOP H WAIT FOR GUARD. Tony obediently stops. BIG TONY (CONT’D) What are you doing?  67.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It says to wait.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: You can go. That's an old sign. They changed the rule.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Let's give it a minute.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: He's not coming. Just go! (sighs ) We can't be related. There's ANOTHER CAR behind them. It HONKS impatiently. BIG TONY (CONT’D) Did you get your gun back?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yes I did.

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY
dialogues.text: Can I borrow it?
